intro: Cnidoscolus sinaloensis, commonly known as the Sinaloan stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, stinging leaves that can cause irritation upon contact. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. It is often found in disturbed soils and along stream banks, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
